pros: Great company, owners care about the families.

job_title: Family Resource Coordinator in Burien, WA
pros: I loved how democratic the decision making process was. The whole team was a part of the interview process; I remember attending a team meeting so I could meet who I would be working with and they could get a sense of who I was.
cons: Not very much opportunity for professional development, especially as an FRC. I had to really advocate for myself to attend trainings or grow in my skills.

job_title: Speech Language Pathology in Springfield, VA
pros: You get to collaborate with amazing OT and PTs.
cons: Very difficult to stay as an SLP; ridiculous turnover

pros: Good family environment and good teamwork. Excellent mentor/training program by skilled and experienced therapists.
cons: Pediatrics requires late hours which can be difficult.

pros: Love it here would go back any time.
Team environment is unparalleled! CTC provides an environment of support and mentorship that goes beyond the first weeks of employment.
cons: None that I can think of!

pros: Great staffing! Team members are committed to the organization's mission. Lots of energy and opportunities for growth!
cons: Demand for services is high in South King County / Pierce County.  We can't grow fast enough / hire enough experienced pediatric therapists to meet the need. As therapist service delivery increases, the IT staffing will also grow to meet the business need.

pros: Great mission. Great culture. Great people.
cons: Nonprofit healthcare is a tough business to be in but very rewarding
